      17             : #include "nsTArray.h"
      18             : 
      19             : class nsStyleContext;
      20             : 
      21             : namespace mozilla {
      22             : 
      23             : /**
      24             :  * nsRuleNodeCacheConditions is used to store information about whether
      25             :  * we can store a style struct that we're computing in the rule tree.
      26             :  *
      27             :  * For inherited structs (i.e., structs with inherited properties), we
      28             :  * cache the struct in the rule tree if it does not depend on any data
      29             :  * in the style context tree, and otherwise store it in the style
      30             :  * context tree.  This means that for inherited structs, setting any
      31             :  * conditions is equivalent to making the struct uncacheable.
      32             :  *
      33             :  * For reset structs (i.e., structs with non-inherited properties), we
      34             :  * are also able to cache structs in the rule tree conditionally on
      35             :  * certain common conditions.  For these structs, setting conditions
      36             :  * (SetFontSizeDependency, SetWritingModeDependency) instead causes the
      37             :  * struct to be stored, with the condition, in the rule tree.
      38             :  */
      39             : class RuleNodeCacheConditions
      40             : {
      41             : public:
      42             :   RuleNodeCacheConditions()
      43           0 :     : mFontSize(0), mBits(0) {}
      44             :   RuleNodeCacheConditions(const RuleNodeCacheConditions& aOther)
      45           0 :     : mFontSize(aOther.mFontSize), mBits(aOther.mBits) {}
      46             :   RuleNodeCacheConditions& operator=(const RuleNodeCacheConditions& aOther)
      47             :   {
      48             :     mFontSize = aOther.mFontSize;
      49             :     mBits = aOther.mBits;
      50             :     return *this;
      51             :   }
      52             :   bool operator==(const RuleNodeCacheConditions& aOther) const
      53             :   {
      54             :     return mFontSize == aOther.mFontSize &&
      55             :            mBits == aOther.mBits;
      56             :   }
      57             :   bool operator!=(const RuleNodeCacheConditions& aOther) const
      58             :   {
      59             :     return !(*this == aOther);
      60             :   }
      61             : 
      62             :   bool Matches(nsStyleContext* aStyleContext) const;
      63             : 
      64             :   /**
      65             :    * Record that the data being computed depend on the font-size
      66             :    * property of the element for which they are being computed.
      67             :    *
      68             :    * Note that we sometimes actually call this when there is a
      69             :    * dependency on the font-size property of the parent element, but we
      70             :    * only do so while computing inherited structs (nsStyleFont), and we
      71             :    * only store reset structs conditionally.
      72             :    */
      73             :   void SetFontSizeDependency(nscoord aCoord)
      74             :   {
      75             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!(mBits & eHaveFontSize) || mFontSize == aCoord);
      76           0 :     mFontSize = aCoord;
      77           0 :     mBits |= eHaveFontSize;
      78             :   }
      79             : 
      80             :   /**
      81             :    * Record that the data being computed depend on the writing mode of
      82             :    * the element for which they are being computed, which in turn
      83             :    * depends on its 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'
      84             :    * properties.
      85             :    */
      86           0 :   void SetWritingModeDependency(uint8_t aWritingMode)
      87             :   {
      88             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!(mBits & eHaveWritingMode) || GetWritingMode() == aWritingMode);
      89             :     mBits |= (static_cast<uint64_t>(aWritingMode) << eWritingModeShift) |
      90           0 :              eHaveWritingMode;
      91           0 :   }
      92             : 
      93             :   void SetUncacheable()
      94             :   {
      95           0 :     mBits |= eUncacheable;
      96             :   }
      97             : 
      98             :   bool Cacheable() const
      99             :   {
     100           0 :     return !(mBits & eUncacheable);
     101             :   }
     102             : 
     103             :   bool CacheableWithDependencies() const
     104             :   {
     105             :     return !(mBits & eUncacheable) &&
     106             :            (mBits & eHaveBitsMask) != 0;
     107             :   }
     108             : 
     109             :   bool CacheableWithoutDependencies() const
     110             :   {
     111             :     // We're not uncacheable and we have don't have a font-size or
     112             :     // writing mode value.
     113           0 :     return (mBits & eHaveBitsMask) == 0;
     114             :   }
     115             : 
     116             : #ifdef DEBUG
     117             :   void List() const;
     118             : #endif
     119             : 
     120             : private:
     121             :   enum {
     122             :     eUncacheable      = 0x0001,
     123             :     eHaveFontSize     = 0x0002,
     124             :     eHaveWritingMode  = 0x0004,
     125             :     eHaveBitsMask     = 0x00ff,
     126             :     eWritingModeMask  = 0xff00,
     127             :     eWritingModeShift = 8,
     128             :   };
     129             : 
     130             :   uint8_t GetWritingMode() const
     131             :   {
     132             :     return static_cast<uint8_t>(
     133           0 :         (mBits & eWritingModeMask) >> eWritingModeShift);
     134             :   }
     135             : 
     136             :   // The font size from which em units are derived.
     137             :   nscoord mFontSize;
     138             : 
     139             :   // Values in mBits:
     140             :   //   bit 0:      are we set to "uncacheable"?
     141             :   //   bit 1:      do we have a font size value?
     142             :   //   bit 2:      do we have a writing mode value?
     143             :   //   bits 3-7:   unused
     144             :   //   bits 8-15:  writing mode (uint8_t)
     145             :   //   bits 16-31: unused
     146             :   uint32_t mBits;
